From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure the default action of a watchdog timeout for a process using a scheduler, use the **scheduler process-watchdog** command in global configuration mode. To disable the configuration, use the **no** form of this command.
CLIs: scheduler process-watchdog { hang | normal | reload | terminate }

ParaDef.Info: Retains the process but does not schedule it.

Examples: The following example shows how to configure the default action of a watchdog timeout for a process using a scheduler:
ExtraInfo: The watchdog timer sets the interval after which the scheduler assumes a process has been suspended or stalled and needs to be stopped.

RelatedCmds.description: Configures the maximum time in milliseconds that a scheduler can run without flagging an error.
